intro: Chromolaena campestris, commonly known as field chromolaena, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its erect, branching stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in composite heads, which are typical of the daisy family. It is often found in open areas, disturbed soils, and along roadsides. Chromolaena campestris is known for its rapid growth and can become invasive in certain environments.
